alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 22 at 5:49PM EDT until May 22 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Johnston County in central North Carolina... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 549 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Smithfield, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Smithfield, Clayton, Selma, Four Oaks, Emit, Flowers and Buckhorn Reservoir. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
